content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the entire gang is there, eating breakfast. Phoebe is on the couch, fidgeting.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What am I sitting on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Top of the world? Dock of the bay? (He tries to think of another but can’t) I’m out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ew-eww!! Undies!
content.parenthetical: taking something out of the couch

content.text: (She throws them into the kitchen and Rachel picks them up with the handle of a large spoon. Chandler and Monica have horrified looks on their faces.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right! Who’s are they? Who’s are they?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, they’re not mine!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, they’re Joey’s! They gotta be Joey’s!
(Rachel turns and stares at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, they’re mine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See? They’re Joey’s! J-J-J-J-J-Joey’s!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why are they here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know uhh… (Pause as he thinks about it.) Well, I’m Joey. Yeah, I’m disgusting, I take my underwear off in other people’s homes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, get ’em out of here! What’s wrong with you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Take ’em! (Joey makes a noise and jumps out of the way.) Joey, you can touch them! They’re your underwear.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler? A word.
(Follows Joey into their apartment and shrugs on his way out.)
[Cut to the guy’s apartment.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s it! I’m tired of covering for you two! This has got to stop! (Realizes he still has the underwear in his hand.) Ahh! (Throws them towards Chandler’s room.) And tighty-whiteys! What are you, 8?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you Joey, thank you so much!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey, no, you’re not welcome. Okay, look, I hate this! You guys keep embarrassing me! (To Monica) Yesterday, Rachel found your razor in our bathroom and I didn’t know what to say, so I said it was mine and-and that I was playing a woman in a play. And one thing led to another and (He puts his leg on the chair and pulls up his pants leg to reveal that he now has shaved legs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! And around the ankles, y’know that is a tough spot.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it was! All right, listen, I can’t…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All this lying has been hard on us too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh, yeah-yeah, I bet all the sex makes it easier!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, yeah actually.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’ll try to be more careful okay? It’s just that, we don’t want everyone to know because this is going really well, and maybe the reason it’s going really well is because it’s a secret.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know it sounds really weird, but we’re just so bad at relationships.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We are! Help us!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Help!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! But, (To Monica) you do it with me once.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Didn’t think so.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there as Phoebe enters with her nose stuck in a book.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Phoebe!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you reading?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, Wethering Heights . I’m taking a literature class at the New School and I have to finish it for the first session tomorrow.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t know you were taking a class. That is so cool.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Well, I really liked that Lamaze class I took! Y’know and this time I thought I’d go for something, y’know a little more intellectual, with a less painful final exam.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey that sounds like fun.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Ooh, you should come with me! Oh yeah, then I’d have someone to sit with!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Okay—ooh, but are you going to have time to read it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I read that in high school.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is going to be so much fun! Okay-shhh, I have to finish.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s wrong buddy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Someone at work ate my sandwich!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, what did the police say?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My Thanksgiving leftover sandwich. I can’t believe someone ate it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross, it’s just a sandwich!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just a sandwich? Look, I am 30 years old, I’m about to be divorced twice and I just got evicted! That sandwich was the only good thing going on in my life! Someone ate the only good thing going on in my life!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, look, I-I have enough stuff for one more sandwich, I mean I was going to eat it myself, but (motions that he can have it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That-that would be incredible. Thank you so much. I-I still can’t believe someone ate it !! I mean, look, I left a note and everything.
(Shows the note to Chandler who reads it aloud.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Knock-knock. Who’s there? Ross Geller’s lunch. Ross Geller’s lunch, who? Ross Geller’s lunch, please don’t take me. Okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m surprised you didn’t go home wearing your lunch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, look you wanna hold onto your food? You gotta scare people off. I learned that living on the street.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?! So what would you say Pheebs? Stuff like uh, “Keep your mitts off my grub?”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Say Ross, when you picture Phoebe living on the street, is she surrounded by the entire cast of Annie ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, this will keep them away from your stuff. (Writes him a note and the gang reads it.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Whoa! Ohh!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you are a bad ass!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Someday I’ll, tell you about the time I stabbed the cop.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he stabbed me first!!

content.description: Phoebe’s class, the class has already started and Rachel walks in late.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry I’m late, but I left late.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So Pheebs, what is the book about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I thought you said you read it in high school.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well yeah, but then I remembered I started it and there was this pep rally and I was, I was on top of the pyramid but anyway—umm, what is this book about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, umm, it’s this tragic love story between Cathy and Heathcliff and umm, it takes place on like these really creepy mores in England. Which I think represents the wildness of Heathcliff’s character. I totally get symbolism.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: How would you characterize the theme of this book, uh let’s see here (looks at his attendance sheet), Rachel Green?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, well I would have to say that it’s a, it’s tragic love story.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Well, that’s sort of a given, but yes. Anyone else?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh-oh, symbolism! And uh, the-the uh, wildness of the mores, which I think is-is mirrored in the wildness of Heathcliff’s character.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Excellent! What Rachel has shrewdly observed here…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You completely stole my answer!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, honey that was pretty obvious.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well how would you know?! You didn’t even read it!

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: What do you think? You in the blue shirt.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think that uh, yours is a question with many answers.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Would ya care to venture one?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Would you care to venture one?

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Are you just repeating what I’m saying?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you just repeating what I’m saying?

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: All right, let’s move on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay then.

content.description: Central Perk, Monica is there as Phoebe and Rachel return from the class.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah but why didn’t you just say that you didn’t read the book?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Be-because I didn’t want him to think I was stupid! I mean, that was really embarrassing what happened to you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe! You’re note, amazing! Not only did no one touch my sandwich, but people at work are actually afraid of me. Yeah, a guy called me mental! Mental Geller, yeah, I always wanted a cool nickname like that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, the best you got in high school was Wet Pants Geller.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was the water fountain! Okay?! Anyway, people are writing reports for me, uh pushing back deadlines to meet my schedule, I’m telling you, you get tough with people you can get anything you want. (Joey walks by with a cup of coffee.) Hey Tribbiani, give me that coffee! Now!
(Joey casually pushes Ross over the back of the couch and sits down proud of himself.)

content.description: The hallway, Joey is returning from a date with Cynthia.

content.speaker: Cynthia
content.text: God, this was really fun! I’ve been wondering if you were going to ask me out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you uh, still wondering?

content.speaker: Cynthia
content.text: No, we just went out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re smart. I like that.

(He goes to open the door to his apartment, but finds it locked. As he’s getting out his keys, Chandler and Monica quickly jump up from making out in the living room and run to Chandler’s bedroom. The apartment has about 20 candles burning all over the place. Joey opens the door and ushers Cynthia in.)

content.speaker: Cynthia
content.text: Oh, candles! (Notices something.) What is that? A blanket? A video camera? Oh my God! (As she storms out, Rachel returns and overhears the conversation.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no, wait-wait-wait!!

content.speaker: Cynthia
content.text: I can’t believe you thought that you were going to video tape us having sex on the first date! (She storms away and Rachel enters to confront Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hiya.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, is what she just said umm—Oh my God. (Looks around the room.) You were actually gonna… (Chandler picks this moment to return to the living room.) (Rachel stares in shock.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is going on here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And with Chandler in the next room. What are you, what are you sick?
(Chandler silently pleads with Joey to cover for them.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m Joey. I mean, I’m disgusting. I make low-budget adult films. (Points at Chandler, angrily.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s; continued from earlier. Joey is closing the door after Rachel leaves and is about to confront Chandler and Monica.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys promised you’d be more careful! I mean, come on! The good Joey name is being dragged through the mud here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re so sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m telling everyone about you! That’s the only way to explain the underwear and the video camera that doesn’t make me look like a pig!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no, wait! There’s got to be a better explanation. You can tell them you had to make an adult film for your (Thinks) adult film class.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I like that. But no-no, how does that explain why Rachel found my underwear at your place?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh—I don’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, get ready to come out of the non-gay closet!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, just wait, please. I promise we’ll come up with something. Just give us a little more time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Hey, but it better make me look really, really good. (Starts for his room.) Oh, and another thing, the video camera? Nice!!

content.description: The Museum of Prehistoric History (Ross’s work); Ross is in the break room eating lunch as his boss, Dr. Leedbetter walks in.

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: Umm, Ross. May I have a word with you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, of course, Donald.

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: We’ve been getting reports of some very angry behavior on your part.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: Threatening letters, refusal to meet deadlines, apparently people now call you mental.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: We want you to speak to a psychiatrist.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no, you-you don’t understand. Ugh, this is so silly. Umm, this is all because of a sandwich.

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: A sandwich?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. You see my-my sister makes these amazing turkey sandwiches. Her secret is, she puts a, an extra slice of gravy soaked bread in the middle; I call it the Moist Maker. Anyway, I-I put my sandwich in the fridge over here…

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: Oh, you know what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: I-I’m sorry. I, I-I-I believe I ate that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You ate my sandwich?

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: It was a simple mistake. It could happen to anyone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh really? Did you confuse it with your own turkey sandwich with a Moist Maker?

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you perhaps seeing a note on top of it?

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: There may have been a-a joke or a limerick of some kind.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That said it was my sandwich?!

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: Now-now calm down. Come look in my office, some of it my still be in the trash.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?
content.parenthetical: jumping to his feet in anger

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: Well, it was quite large. I-I-I-I-I had to throw most of it away.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You-you-you-you (trying to remain in control) threw my sandwich away!
[Cut to an outside shot of the museum.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: MY SANDWICH?!!!
content.parenthetical: losing control, we hear him shout outside

content.text: [Cut to a shot of a park.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: MY SANDWICH!!!!!! (Ross’s scream scares a flight of pigeons away.)

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s class; Rachel walks in, on time this time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So umm, what’s this book about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You didn’t read this one either?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I was gonna, but I accidentally read something else.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Vogue ! Hey, so tell me about this Jane Eyre woman.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! You should’ve read it yourself!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on Phoebe! Don’t be such a goodie-goodie!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine! Okay, all right, so Jane Eyre, first of all, you’d think she’s a woman, but she’s not. She’s a cyborg.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A cyborg?! Isn’t that like a robot?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, this book was light years ahead of its time.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Sorry I’m late. Let’s get started. So, what did everybody think about Jane Eyre?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, Rachel and I were just discussing it and she had some very interesting insights.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Well, go ahead Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, thank you Phoebe. Umm, well, what struck me most when reading Jane Eyre was uh, how the book was so ahead of its time.

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: If you’re talking about feminism, I think you’re right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well, feminism yes, but also the robots.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is on the couch as Monica joins him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. Okay, so umm, since that video camera thing didn’t work out uh, I thought that I would give you just a little preview. (Hands him a Polaroid.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re naked in this picture!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.
(Ross walks in, eating cotton candy. Monica nudges Chandler who hides the picture in his magazine. Ross sits down on the chair, he seems kinda out of it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Chandler. (Sees Monica.) Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, are you okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m fine! I saw a psychiatrist at work today.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: On account of my rage.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Which I may say, right now, is out of control.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He gave me a pill for it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A pill?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh. Well, when the psychiatrist told me I had to take a leave of absence because I yelled at my boss I started to get worked up again, so he offered me a tranquilizer. And I thought was a good idea so, I took it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute, they’re making you take time off work?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And you’re okay with that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know. It’s going to be weird not having a job for a while, but I, I definitely don’t care about my sandwich.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Phoebe are returning from class.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, that was so embarrassing! I can’t believe you let me go on and on like that!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry. It was just so funny when you started comparing Jane Eyre to Robocop .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That was not funny!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I snapped! Okay? You weren’t taking the class seriously.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, come on! What is the big deal? I thought this was going to be something we could do together! Y’know, I thought it would be fun!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, yeah! Fun is good, but y’know I also wanted to learn. Y’know, people are always talking about what they learned in high school and I never went to high school.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh. Oh, so you really wanted to learn. Yeah, y’know, Pheebs I just wanted to have fun. Ohh, you know who you should go with?

content.description: The Class; Monica has taken Rachel’s spot.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! I know! I know!
content.parenthetical: yelling and waving her hand in the air

content.speaker: The Teacher
content.text: Monica, you asked the question.
(She sits back defeated, and Phoebe groans with disgust.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s; Joey returns carrying a bucket of chicken, and starts going through the mail. While doing this, Monica’s picture falls out. He bends over to pick it up and gasps. While he’s staring at the picture, Rachel decides to come over and sees him looking at the picture.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! That’s Monica!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no-no-no! No-no-no-no-no-no-no!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You get away from me!! You sick, sick, sick, sick-o!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s going on?
content.parenthetical: entering, with the rest of the gang

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey has got a secret peephole!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no! No! No! No! (Monica gasps as well.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! He has a naked picture of Monica! He takes naked pictures of us! And then he eats chicken and looks at them!
(Ross stares in shock at him as he angrily puts down the chicken and takes off his coat.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look! (Shows Ross the picture.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude! That’s my sister! (She shows the rest of the gang.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Give me that!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, wait! Just wait. Everybody just calm down. Okay? Let’s give our friend Joey a chance to explain why he’s such a big pervert!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! I am not a pervert! Okay? It’s just… I just… Kinda…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, look! Look. I think I can explain this.
(He walks over and stands behind Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey’s a sex addict.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!! (He turns around and stares at Chandler who’s silently pleading with Joey to go along with it.) No I’m not!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s okay! It’s good! It’s good. It’s a disease!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! I am not a sex addict!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes you are! That’s the only way to explain all this stuff!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No it isn’t! No, it’s not. Because you can also explain it with the truth!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what is the truth?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I slept with Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well let’s…let’s see what everybody thinks of that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You slept with my sister?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh yes, but it was, we just did it once uh, in London.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is not good for my rage. (Takes another pill.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, is this true?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course it’s true! How else would you explain all the weird stuff that’s been going on?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes it’s true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, but if it only happened that one time, how come we found your underwear in our apartment the other day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh—oy! That was the underwear I was wearing that night in London. Right Monica?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess I wanted to keep it (Pause) as a souvenir.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My God Monica!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you sure Joe? Are you sure you’re not just a sex addict?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! If anyone’s a sex addict here, it’s Monica! Yeah. Yeah. She has been trying to get me back in the sack ever since London!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So that’s why she gave you a naked picture of herself.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That makes sense!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And the video camera?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, Monica?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess I set up the video camera to try and entice Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But sadly I could not be enticed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Unbelievable! I mean you really kept Joey’s underwear?! Why? Why would you do that?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m Monica. I’m disgusting. I stalk guys and keep their underpants.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I think we’ve all learned something about who’s disgusting and who’s not. Eh? All right, now, I’m going to get back to my bucket. I’m only eating the skin, so the chicken’s up for grabs. (Offers it to everyone.)

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s class; the class has ended and Phoebe is talking to one of her classmates.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I really thought you making a good point. I mean y’know, until you got cut off.

content.speaker: A Female Student
content.text: Yeah, what’s up with that girl Monica?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know! I didn’t come with her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right everybody! Everybody guess what? I just convinced Paul to give us a test next week!

content.speaker: All
content.text: A test?!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! Tests make us all better learners! Oh yeah! (Running out) We should have essay questions!!
